description: Comprehensive training dataset for function declarations (q:function)

function_types.simple_functions: ✅ Fully covered (3 basic + usage in complex examples)
function_types.recursive_functions: ✅ Fully covered (3 examples: factorial, fibonacci, sum)
function_types.rest_api_functions: ✅ ADDED (7 examples: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, query params, pagination, nested)
function_types.cached_functions: ✅ ADDED (6 examples: basic, parameterized, short/long TTL, conditional, per-user)
function_types.async_functions: ✅ ADDED (5 examples: basic, parallel, sequential, error handling, timeout)

parameter_features.param_validation: ✅ ADDED (7 examples: email, range, CPF, CNPJ, URL, password, multiple)

advanced_features.function_composition: ✅ ADDED (6 examples: calling other functions, nesting, chaining)
advanced_features.caching: ✅ ADDED (6 examples with TTL and cache keys)
advanced_features.rest_api: ✅ ADDED (7 examples: full CRUD + pagination + nested)

training_readiness.notes: Comprehensive coverage of function patterns with 41 positive examples showing multiple implementation styles. Covers basic functions, REST APIs, caching, async operations, validation, and complex integrations with loops/conditionals/state. Demonstrates function composition and real-world API patterns.
recommended_additions: GraphQL function examples (if feature is implemented)
Higher-order function examples (map, filter, reduce patterns)

negative: negative/invalid_syntax.json (6 examples) - Common errors and validation

usage_instructions.for_llm_training: Use positive examples for function generation training. Show LLM multiple ways to solve same problem (e.g., data fetching via simple REST vs cached vs async). REST API examples show full CRUD patterns. Validation examples demonstrate built-in validators. Negative examples teach error detection.
usage_instructions.for_developers: Reference these examples when creating functions. See REST API examples for backend integration. See caching examples for performance optimization. See validation examples for data integrity.
usage_instructions.for_testing: Automated tests should mirror these examples. Each example represents a valid test case covering parameters, return values, and side effects.

example_diversity.implementation_styles: Shows 3-7 different approaches per pattern type
example_diversity.use_cases: REST APIs, caching, async operations, validation, composition, recursion, data processing
example_diversity.multiple_solutions: Same problem solved different ways (e.g., data aggregation via loops vs recursion vs SQL)
